tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE ProductionScheduling ( 
  id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
  product_name VARCHAR(255), 
  production_date DATE, 
  start_time TIME, 
  end_time TIME, 
  resource_allocation INT 
);

CREATE TABLE ProductionSchedule (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    order_id INT,
    product_name VARCHAR(255),
    quantity INT,
    schedule_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE ResourceAllocation (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    resource_id INT,
    resource_name VARCHAR(255),
    allocation_date DATE,
    allocation_status VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE production_schedule ( 
    schedule_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, 
    product_name VARCHAR(255), 
    production_date DATE, 
    daily_production_goal INT 
)

CREATE TABLE resource_allocation ( 
    resource_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, 
    resource_name VARCHAR(255), 
    resource_type VARCHAR(255), 
    available_quantity INT 
)

CREATE TABLE production_efficiency ( 
    efficiency_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, 
    schedule_id INT REFERENCES production_schedule(schedule_id), 
    efficiency_score FLOAT, 
    efficiency_date DATE 
)

CREATE TABLE optimization_results ( 
    result_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, 
    schedule_id INT REFERENCES production_schedule(schedule_id), 
    resource_id INT REFERENCES resource_allocation(resource_id), 
    efficiency_id INT REFERENCES production_efficiency(efficiency_id), 
    optimization_timestamp TIMESTAMP 
)

CREATE TABLE production_schedule (
    production_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    product_name VARCHAR(50),
    start_date TIMESTAMP,
    end_date TIMESTAMP,
    allocated_resources INT
);
